metadata.title: Pounds to Kilograms (lbs to kg) Converter – Official Standard
metadata.description: Convert pounds to kilograms using the exact 0.45359237 international standard. Get NIST-traceable results for science, engineering, and everyday use.

introduction: This pounds to kilograms converter provides scientifically accurate results based on the international standard, making it a trusted tool for engineers, students, and professionals in international trade.
Every calculation uses the exact 1 lb = 0.45359237 kg formula, ensuring your conversions are precise for shipping manifests, scientific research, and health data.
We provide the official formula, worked examples, and authoritative context to help you convert pounds to kilograms with confidence and avoid common rounding errors.
methodology: To convert pounds (lbs) to kilograms (kg), the calculator multiplies the pound value by exactly 0.45359237. [2, 3]

This factor is not an approximation but an exact definition established by the 1959 International Yard and Pound Agreement, which defined the international avoirdupois pound in terms of the kilogram. [2, 13]
This standard is recognized by metrology institutions worldwide, including the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) in the United States, ensuring global consistency. [15, 16]
examples: International Travel: A traveler with a 50 lb suitcase for a flight will find it weighs 22.68 kg, helping them meet airline baggage allowances that are often specified in kilograms. [14]
Health & Fitness: A person weighing 175 lbs is 79.38 kg. This conversion is essential for tracking body mass in medical charts or fitness apps that use the metric system.
Engineering: A component specified to withstand a load of 2,000 pounds-force is designed for approximately 8,896 newtons, a calculation that starts with converting the mass from pounds to kilograms.

faqs.question: What is the exact formula to convert pounds to kilograms?
faqs.answer: The official formula is: kilograms = pounds × 0.45359237. This is an exact definition, not a rounded number. [6, 9]

faqs.question: How many kilograms are in a pound?
faqs.answer: There are exactly 0.45359237 kilograms in one international avoirdupois pound. This has been the formal standard since 1959. [2, 3]

faqs.question: What is the difference between a pound of mass and a pound of force?
faqs.answer: A pound (lb) of mass is a measure of the amount of matter in an object (0.45359237 kg). A pound-force (lbf) is the force of gravity on that mass. While often used interchangeably in daily life, they are distinct scientific units. This calculator converts mass. [7]

faqs.question: Why is using an exact conversion factor important?
faqs.answer: Using the exact factor is critical for scientific accuracy, engineering specifications, and international trade to prevent errors and ensure that measurements are consistent and interoperable across different systems.

To convert from pounds to kilograms, multiply the number of pounds by 0.45359237. [1, 6]
